results.title: Salaam Bombay!
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Channel 4, Cadrage (Paris) and Mirabai Films
results.brief_description: Abandoned by the travelling fair for which he works, 11 year old Krishna takes a train to the nearest city - Bombay. He is initiated into the ways of the city by various members of a children’s street gang and, determined to save up enough money to get home, begins work at the bottom of the street hierarchy as a “Chaipau” or tea-boy. Through his eyes we glimpse a Bombay never seen in traditional Indian studio-based films, a city of madness and cacophony, where flesh and drugs are traded and everywhere there are children like Krishna, surviving and succumbing to the appetite of the raging metropolis. Movingly acted by real street kids this film is an eloquent addition to the cinema’s portraits of troubled childhood.

results.title: Saint-Urbain in Troyes
results.creator_credit: Yves Leduc, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of one of the oldest Gothic cathedrals of France, built in 1262 during what was known as the century of cathedrals. This film shows the details of exteriors and interiors - the lofty spire, the lacework of stone, and the luminous flood of light through stained glass windows. Comparisons are made between St. Urbain and other ancient French churches. The city of Troyes is seen as it is today and as it was in medieval times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yves Leduc, Francois Seguillon and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Sails of exploration
results.brief_description: Shows the historical development of water transportation by sail power, describing the role of such ships in discovering new lands, mapping the globe, and linking together the people of the world. Discusses the importance of the clipper ship in the early economic life of the United States. Includes re-enactments, drawings and archival film.

results.title: Sailors in the making
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Australia. Royal Australian Navy. Public Relations
results.brief_description: The training of recruits at the Flinders Naval Depot. Basic training given to all recruits in seamanship, fire-fighting and damage control. The training ships and the facilities of the Depot for self-improvement - library, common room, theatre, chapels, sport. Some of the thirteen special schools - naval gunnery, electrical, engineering and advanced seamanship.

results.title: Sailor Moon. Ep 9: The Return of the doom tree [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Junichi Sato, Louise Hurtubise and Toei Animation
results.brief_description: Six episodes of the Japanese animated television series, “Sailor Moon”, entitled “The Return of the doom tree”. The setting is Cross Roads Junior High School and Serena, a young girl, possesses a magical brooch that invokes mystical forces, transforming her into the powerful Sailor Moon, a super-heroine whose mission is to protect humanity from evil demons from a parallel universe. Fellow Sailor Scouts, Jupiter, Mercury and Mars join her on her adventures. Episodes include: “Food fetish” Serena suspects that Darien, who she has a major crush on, may be the Moonlight Knight; “Mirror, mirror on the wall” When Darien stages Snow White and the seven dwarfs, the Sailor scouts compete for the major parts but wicked ulterior motives mar the proceedings; “Detention doldrums” Much to her dismay, Serena is detained after school. “Secret garden” When Serena uncovers the secret identities of Alan and Anne, she has to use the zenith of her powers to fight for her life. “Treed” Serena struggles to free herself from Alan and Anne’s doom tree. “Serena times two” Serena becomes jealous when a wicked baby falls from the sky in search of a powerful crystal. Based on the original comic “Sailor Moon” by Naoko Takeuchi. The series is underpinned by the decent moral codes of friendship, honesty, responsible behaviour, respect and selflessness.

results.title: Sailor Moon. Ep 8: The Doom tree strikes [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Junichi Sato, Louise Hurtubise and Toei Animation
results.brief_description: Six episodes of the Japanese animated television series, “Sailor Moon”, entitled “The doom tree strikes”. The setting is Cross Roads Junior High School, and Serena, a young girl possesses a magical brooch that invokes mystical forces, transforming her into the powerful Sailor Moon, a super-heroine whose mission is to protect humanity from evil demons from a parallel universe. Fellow Sailor Scouts, Jupiter, Mercury and Mars join her on her adventures. Episodes featured are: “A Knight to remember” When a monstrous creature attacks the Sailor crew, a mysterious knight (could it be Darien?) comes to the rescue; “VR madness” A virtual reality theatre is the location for the mega-verse’s latest assault, but without her tiara, Serena is helpless to aid her imperilled family. “Cherry blossom time” Sailor Moon and her friends are in danger when they are captured by alien beings. “Kindergarten chaos” Several potent beings with malevolent intentions threaten the lives of kindergarten children, until the Sailor crew intervene. “Much ado about babysitting” Darien and Sailor Moon baby-sit together whilst evil forces try to rob babies of their energy. “Raye’s day in the spotlight” Raye organises and stars in the Autumn festival but a monster from a mega-verse makes a guest appearance. Based on the original comic “Sailor Moon” by Naoko Takeuchi, the series is underpinned by the decent moral codes of friendship, honesty, responsible behaviour, respect and selflessness.

results.title: Sailor beware = Panic in the parlour
results.creator_credit: Gordon Parry, Jack Clayton, Romulus Films and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: From the stage play “Sailor beware” by Philip King and Falkland L. Cary with an introduction by Bill Collins. A humorous tale of domestic conflict between Shirley (Shirley Eaton), her prospective sailor husband-to-be Albert (Ronald Lewis) and Shirley’s overbearing acerbic tongued mother, Emma (Peggy Mount). Cast includes Cyril Smith, Esme Cannon, Gordon jackson, Geoffrey Keen, Joy Webster, Thora Hird.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gordon Parry, Jack Clayton, Romulus Films and British Lion Films

results.title: Sailing the Greek Isles
results.brief_description: Join Scott Lambert and three other Australians, along with a Greek skipper, for a month among the beautiful Greek Islands. Visit the island of Mykonos with its wonderful Cubist architecture, Rhodes with its castles of the Knights of St John built over 500 years ago, Siftos and Santorini. Legend has it that Santorini, the island on the rim of a giant volcanic crater, and believed to be the home of vampires, is the site of the lost city of Atlantis. Then travel with the group to Turkey, home of the traditional enemies of the Greeks, and visit Effasis the second largest city of the Roman Empire, and then on to see the reputed house of the Virgin Mary.
